question.body: Which of these cranial nerves are involved in movement of the eye?

response.feedback: Incorrect. One of these produces tears, but neither is involved in movement of the eye.
Incorrect. One of these is involved in vision, not movement of the eye.
Correct. All three move one or more of the six external eye muscles.
Incorrect. Only one of these is involved in movement of the eye.
Incorrect. Neither of these are involved in movement of the eye.

question.body: Which of these cranial nerves is NOT involved in swallowing?

response.feedback: Correct. This cranial nerve is involved with movement of the eye.
Incorrect. This is involved in movement for swallowing as well as taste.
Incorrect. This is involved in movement for swallowing as well as taste.
Incorrect. This is involved in movement for swallowing.
Incorrect. This is involved in movement of tongue associated with swallowing.

question.body: Which of these cranial nerves are involved in taste?

response.feedback: Incorrect. Neither of these are involved in taste.
Incorrect. One of these is involved in taste, but not the other and other cranial nerves are also involved in taste.
Incorrect. One of these is not involved in tastes.
Correct. All three carry sensory signals from part of tongue or pharynx for taste.
Incorrect. While all three are associated with swallowing, only one has a sensory function.
